name: Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles

reviews.text: I stay at the Sheraton LAX a few times a year for business. Its great place to stay for business while in LA. I person that always stands out is Estela Estrada. A great server that always takes cares of our group. Always has a smile in her face and makes sure that everyone has what they need. Thank you for all your hard work Estela!
reviews.title: Great Staff and overall Service

reviews.text: Stayed one night before catching a flight the following day to Vegas. The hotel has a great bar and really nice pool. $20 taxi journey gets you a nice night out in Marina Del Ray.
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel

reviews.text: Courtesy bus to and from the airport was effortless.
reviews.title: A nice place to wait for your next fly at the LA airport

reviews.text: Nice and clean room, oversized bed and nice decoration. The breakfast is great. Many different options at hte buffet and gentle and kind personal. Free airport shuttle every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: Estela Estrada was a great server and made sure everything we needed was taken care of. Her exceptional service made dining at the LAX Sheraton Gateway Hotel pleasant.
reviews.title: Great Banquets Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I give this hotel a neutral. I stayed here in my recent trip to LA. I find booking through spg.com or starwood phone very conveninent if you are an SPG member, so I picked this one up because of location and price.
reviews.title: parking situation

likes.liked: — aviation pictures in the rooms and throughout the hotel

reviews.text: The location is good, I stayed at other hotels at LAX, nothing unusual here. Rooms are ok sized, nicely furnished, positive sides of my stay.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had 2 issues with the room in my 2 days stay, one with the heater and the other one with the bathtub drainage, but it was taken careof, so it is OK.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: However, parking drama is another story. Hotel only provides Valet parking for $24 a day. Or you park in the airport parking lots behind the hotel.(for $13). The problem here is, at night, you have to walk back to the front door from parking lot through some dark road, since all the side doors of the hotel are closed.Very inconvenient. Valet parking is not too good either, because of the crowds picking up their cars.
reviews.title: NIce Hotel; Recently Remodeled

likes.liked: — quality for price ratio was good
likes.disliked: — location a bit distance from LA attractions other than airport, but not bad driving

reviews.text: I stayed at the radisson LAX and also paid for parking there but at least, parking was closer.
reviews.title: Ok for Sheraton

likes.disliked: — Too noisy after hours--not good insulation

reviews.text: It is not the first time I have stayed there. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest. Sheraton is normally synonymous with quality and comfort. Still, I was disappointed this time with my overnight stay. Half of the elevators did not work and the room clearly needed upgrading and refurbishing.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

likes.disliked: — room ( old and worn-out furniture / cracks in the bathroom walls)

reviews.text: More, the buffet breakfast is not up to one's expectations.
reviews.title: Best Airport Hotel Bar None
Not the greatest experience
reviews.text: Compared to other hotels of the same category in the vicinity,- the Westin in particular-the Sheraton Gateway has obviously lost part of its gloss and therefore become too expensive for what it actually offers.

This is the BEST airport hotel property I have ever stayed at. There is almost nothing to do around LAX, very few restaurants, bars, fun things to do. So if you have to be there for a nite before you leave town, this is the best hotel to stay at. By far!
reviews.title: Los Angeles by Night
decent hotel near airport
reviews.text: The vibe feels almost European, maybe b/c several of the front desk people are, maybe because of the very sleek feeling of the hotel. I feel more like I am in the downtown of a fun city than at an airport area with nothing going on.

reviews.title: 80% good, 20% not so good
reviews.text: A got a wicked good deal on this hotel through Priceline, so I really can't complain about too much.

reviews.title: Pretty decent airport hotel
reviews.text: As far as the hotel, it is fairly modern and conveniently located to LAX. The shuttle from LAX was fast and the driver was very friendly.

reviews.title: Solid business hotel in a good location
reviews.text: The room itself was pretty big and had updated decor, but the bathroom was small and in need of renovation. Why would you update the room, but not the bathroom? I don't understand it. The enamel on the bathtub was peeling and you could barely close the door while using the toilet. I also expected the bed to be a little more comfortable ... that wasn't the case however.

reviews.title: Wonderful night at the Sheraton
reviews.text: Pros: Very nice (and free) weight room, free Wi-Fi in the lobby, Starbucks in lobby, shuttle bus to airport, location near LAX.

reviews.title: Convenient and modern!
reviews.text: Cons: Elevators were slow and at one point was dropping people off on the wrong floor, $13 for offsite parking, expensive restaurants onsite (I walked to a Marriott down the road just to get a cheaper meal at a sports bar), no retail establishments nearby (food or shopping), old 25 inch TVs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel recently and I had a great experience. I am a Starwood Gold Member so I got the room free through points. At check-in, the employee wasn't too great or nice but did get the job done. I checked in very fast with no problems which I always enjoy. I especially liked the room that they put me in. There are 15 floors and I was on the 14th overlooking LAX with a great view of the runways and the airport itself. The room was good size, the sheets, bathroom and everything was clean so I was very satisfied. The only dissatifcation I had was the desk. It was made of wood and there was a lot of chips on the top and the side which were very noticeable. Just a little paint would make it look much better but that was just a minute detail. Everything else was way above satisfactory. I strongly recommend you stay at the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles. It is very close to LAX and everything around and in Los Angeles.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in LA for vacation in Oct 07. Chose to stay near the airport as we did not want to pay extras for hotels and parkings at the downtown. Paid $75 per night for Sheraton, and we thought it was reasonable.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was convenient to drive to our destinations, e.g. Universal Studio, Beverly Hills, Hollywood. We chose to self park at the back of the hotel, which cost $13.25 per night.
reviews.title: Needed a refurb about 10 years ago!!
Decent but dated
reviews.text: We were quite disappointed with the dirty sheets in our room. When we informed the reception, the person was not professional in attending to us, merely acknowledging, not attempt to provide any constructive solutions/suggestions. She said new sheets will be sent in 30 mins time. We were extremely unhappy as it was 1230am and we were dead tired from our 380 miles drive from San Fran that day! When the sheets finally came in 10 mins time, the housekeeping staff just brought the sheets into our room and expected us to change it ourselves!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not a bad hotel at all, with its nice and modern deco and its facilities, but i think the hotel staff should be able to handle issues in a more professional manner.
reviews.title: Good but for the Elevators!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One doesn't expect an airport hotel to be great. it's there for convenience and location. This one while having a somewhat stylish room also had a television which was too dim (and when I asked about it was told that it was my eyesight - blame the customer!) a bathroom which not only lacked a bath mat but featured plastic cups and bath gel , no shampoo. The "free" wifi was ultimately free but first you had to be charged $11.99 to use it. I waited for 45 minutes for the shuttle at the airport and when I called was unable to speak to a human being. Another thing about the TV was that it paused for 8 seconds between stations while surfing. Not fun. But at least it was clean and soundproof.
reviews.title: the bed was comfortable but the rest was utilitarian at best.

reviews.text: I would not normally choose an airport hotel, but he convenience and value of this one wins he day. Great service, friendly attitude and nice hotel.
reviews.title: Great service and value.

reviews.text: I was impressed with the excellent customer service provided by Diane Cheek and Merlee Pickett. They attended to my every concern and need swiftly, effectively and with a most cheerful attitude. This hotel is lucky to have such impressive employees.
reviews.title: Accommodating

reviews.text: loved it as was very nice convenient to lax and reasonable price
reviews.title: great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton Gateway is a very large, airport hotel. It is situated close to the terminals (still too far to walk though).
reviews.title: Nothing to get excited about (not sure why others are)
Very poor for a Sheraton
reviews.text: Service is awful, the elevators weren’t working, we never got attended on the bar. I was very sick and there wasn’t even a doctor available on the hotel. If you need to stay in LAX, look somewhere else.

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay At The Sheraton
reviews.text: Everything was great. We stayed here for five night in Feb 2007. We felt the parking was a problem but then we just figured we would park on the street behind the hotel for free instead of spending the 14 dollars a day. There was usually always a spot. Anyways rooms were very clean, beds were awesome and the gym was top notch. All in all definatly would stay here again.

reviews.title: Shame about the parking
reviews.text: Stayed at this property from Jan 26th - Jan 29th and again on the night of Feb 1st.

reviews.title: ok
reviews.text: This hotel is really nice except for a few small details, Charging guests to park their cars is a little over the top when the car park (not the valet parking) is a 5 minute walk behind the hotel...not alot you might say, but when I stayed, the car park was almost full and I had to park at the furthest point from the entrance and then had to walk in very heavy rain to get to the hotel...and I got charged about €13 per day for this privledge. Its a public car park , but Sheraton guests get a special rate...big deal!!!

reviews.title: surprisingly nice airport hotel
reviews.text: My room was excellent but the door lock (electronic) required attention and after I was told it was fixed, it still caused problems...like locking me out of my room each time.

This is the second time I stayed here. I was pretty happy the first time. Like the first time, I booked through Priceline (which calls this a 4-star hotel...that's awfully generous) for $80/night. The hotel seemed pretty busy when I checked in, so I guess they figured they could give a cheapskate Priceline customer one of the handicapped rooms. I asked for a new room, but they said they had no regular rooms available...right. The quality of their handicapped rooms is just not the same as their regular rooms. In addition to the cheap features in the bathroom (the tile and curtains in the shower reminded me of my days living in the dorms), there was a stain on the curtains, a big chip in the veneer on the furniture (yup...veneer furniture), a huge nasty yellow stain on the desk chair (needless to say I didn't sit on it) and a stain on the carpet. The walls are paper thin -- I could hear phone conversations from the next room at normal volume through the wall.
reviews.title: Nice, if you can get it cheap enough

reviews.text: Nevertheless, this place is a decent deal at about $75 per night...anything more and you'll probably be severly disappointed. Total ripoff at their standard rates. Definitely not a 4-star hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: First of all this Sheraton just completed a multi-million dollar renovation and it shows. The lobby and check-in area very open and modern. Check-in was a breeze. The guest rooms feature the new Sheraton beds, excellent work area and a very nice large chair by the window. I used the fitness center and I must say it is one of the best, each machine has its own flat-screen tv and everyone gets their own pair of headphones. It overlooks the outdoor pool area which has poolside cabanas, palm trees, and in the evening poolside cocktail service. There is a full-service Starbucks just off the lobby and its a little oasis from the busy lobby. The airport shuttle is very frequent and depending on which terminal you can even walk. By far the best part of this hotel is the fact that you do not feel like you are right next to LAX.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but expected more from Sheraton. Would stay for same price.

reviews.text: Got a hotel for about $119 through my employer's travel agent. (Rooms on web travel sites list $195). Picked this hotel because of location (meeting across the street) and the price I paid. Room was nice, but I expected more from a Sheraton and especially if I would have paid full price. Perhaps they give the nicer rooms to those who pay full price. Never understand why these hotels nickel and dime you for internet access. It is extra. Good choice for a hotel across from LAX. Free shuttle to the airport and a free shuttle to the $12 night parking (a bit of a walk if you don't want to wait for the shuttle. NOTE: There are spaces reserved on near the entrance for the Sheraton, but I did not see them until I had already parked and carried my 2 bags about 100 ft.
reviews.title: Perfect for overnight stay before leaving

likes.liked: — close to LAX and frequent shuttles to LAX
likes.disliked: — Few TV channels and no refrigerator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal via Hotwire. Very clean and modern hotel and room. Unloaded the family and luggage in the loading zone before returning my van to Enterprise and getting dropped off back at the hotel. I didn't want the hassle of returning our vehicle or pay for guest parking. We just ate the food we bought from a take-out restaurant in LA and slept in our room, then rushed out. I checked out by phone later. The room was quiet and of decent size. I would have liked more than the 10-15 or so TV channels, though. A small refrigerator would have been helpful too. We would have bought coffee at the downstair Starbucks if we had time. The close location to the airport and shuttle every 10 minutes was very comforting for a quick departure for a morning flight. My wife was right: if we had stayed where we were previously in Orange County, we would've ran into problems getting ready for and catching our flight. I'd definitely stay there again for an overnighter, but that's about it.
reviews.title: Good Gateway
Boutique-quality hotel right by the airport
reviews.text: The Sheraton LAX felt like a boutique hotel - interesting artwork in the lobby, amazing 1920s-ish furniture all around the public floors, lovely poolside area & bar for late-night drinks, and extremely comfortable & well-decorated guestrooms; so much nicer than I expected for an airport hotel (and free with Starwood points!) Transport from the hotel was quick and easy, and we knew we'd made an excellent choice when we saw pilots pouring into the hotel for a good night's sleep...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this hotel to visit family and friends in the South Bay area. The location was very convenient for our purposes. We've stayed at Sheraton properties quite often before, and have found them to be generally good, but not usually this good.
reviews.title: Sheraton LAX Exceeded Expectations

likes.liked: — Big room, nicely furnished. Friendly staff. Starbucks.

reviews.text: Our room, which I don't think was a special one, was quite spacious with excellent furnishings and a most comfy bed. I wasn't expecting such a large room and first cabin bed, given the price and airport location. All the staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, which was an impressively efficient operation in spite of serving a crush of customers every morning. What looked like a twenty minute line for coffee turned out to be a five minute wait at the most. Kudos to them!
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.text: In spite of being an extremely busy airport hotel the elevators were prompt and speedy even early in the morning when they often bog down at most hotels. I had occasion to use the fitness center and found the cardio equipment to be very good, the weight gear is just ok. The only real gripes we could think of was a $6 charge to use the lobby computers, a bit of a silly rip-off of paying guests needing to print a boarding pass. Also, a little fridge in the room would be nice.
reviews.title: A lovely surprise for an airport hotel!

reviews.text: The free shuttle to Manhattan Beach for shopping and beach stuff is a wonderful service.
reviews.title: Convenient to LAX, average accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

likes.disliked: — they fixed them right away so no real complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: Very un-Sheraton looking. Sleek & Modern on the inside. Doormen did not offer to help with the bags but I guess we looked like we did not need assistance. They were pleasant though. The front desk was very helpful at check in and check out. Nice pool area with whirlpool (had leaves in it) as well. There was a bar and 2 restaurants (1 AM and 1 PM) and a Starbucks. Shuttle to the airport very early in the morning was spot on.
reviews.title: ideal for a layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Very nice. Horrible noise from the air con that the maintenance man fixed straight away. Comfy bed. TV had some sound issues. I could not get the broadband to work but that was my computers fault. Good size desk. Very little outside noise noticed. USA Today at the door in the morning. Adequate bathroom facilites and good towels.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good choice if you need a hotel at LAX.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: A very clean comfortable hotel, ideal for an airport layover. No noise from aircraft or roadway. Very good value for the money.
reviews.title: Comfortable Accommodations - Awkward Building

reviews.text: booked this hotel on their website for a business trip. Triple AAA rate was $119, which certainly seemed a better deal than something like Priceline, given that I was guarenteed a no-smoking room.
reviews.title: Good choice at LAX

reviews.text: Shuttle from terminal to the hotel came quickly, and got us to the hotel quickly.
reviews.title: Best hotel by LAX

likes.liked: — Location and room rates within my budget

reviews.text: Four of us booked separate rooms for the same meeting and we were all pleased. I asked for a quiet room when I booked, and when I checked in they noted my request and put me in an end room that was indeed very quiet. Check in was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Fooled me twice!!

reviews.text: The room was large (though bathroom was small to average in size), with nice, soothing colors and furnishings. Very comfortable King bed with lots of pillows. The room was very clean. One minor rawback: there was high speed internet, but apparently not wireless (at least, I couldn't get my wireless to work but didn't try calling the desk to ask about it, since I was only there one night.)
reviews.title: Buyer Beware

reviews.text: Only one of us had a car; she used the valet which she said was only slightly more than the park yourself option.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel out of convenience for a work trip (and because I'm a SPG member). I travel quite a bit and stay in mostly Ws and an occasional Westin or Sheraton. It's completely on par with other Sheratons I've stayed at in the past...everything pretty standard, clean, decent service, etc. It's also FAR better than most airport hotels (I normally won't stay in airport hotels as they tend to be yucky)
reviews.title: Solid Sheraton

likes.liked: — Proximity to the airport w/free shuttle

reviews.text: The pool area is nice with a decent sized pool and nice furniture (like you'd normally find in a resort-type hotel). Check in was quick and friendly. My room (an executive suite) was large, nice and clean...it faced the street/runway and contrary to some of the other reviews, you could barely hear a thing. I ordered room service for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the quality.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: To those knocking this place (or to those wondering if you should stay here), please remember that it is (a) a Sheraton, so you should know what to expect (b) an airport hotel, and (c) very reasonably priced for what you're getting...and you generally get what you pay for. If you want luxury resort/Ritz type experience (which by some of the reviews is what I assume people honestly expected by their commentary), pay the money and stay at the Ritz.
reviews.title: Mixed Experience

reviews.text: i got a good rate on priceline which was just as well because the rack rate would have been extortionate for the state of the bathroom and services. The bathroom was dirty; far more water came out of the tap than out of the showerhead on the shower setting; the water did not drain from the tub. Yuk. The "pinstripe" dark decor is depressing. The pool was nice early in the morning but in the afternoon there was a corporate function going on and since it's a small pool area it wasn't really inviting for an informal swim. Most of the lifts didn't work -- it took about 15 minutes to get down. The concierge sighed when I wanted to buy a stamp. The room service food was, as expected, overpriced and ridiculously salty. I wouldn't stay again.
reviews.title: Convenient to LAX

reviews.text: We got a good deal through Hotwire. Very nice hotel - nice rooms, good breakfast, decent outdoor pool, handy for airport. We did however encounter a few problems 1) the free shuttle bus from the airport dropped us at the far end of the airport parking lot - a few minutes walk from the lobby - with 2 young children and 4 large cases this was not a good start! 2) the room we were assigned had not been serviced - beds not made, plate of food thrown across the floor, dirty bathroom - you get the picture. 3) Elevators slow, as some of them were out of order so getting back to reception after getting the unserviced room took a while 4) - and this was my biggest problem - the attitude of the front desk staff when reporting the unserviced bedroom - not a word of apology and no manners. Don't get me wrong - we enjoyed our stay and feel that we were just unlucky with the room, but I feel the front desk staff let the hotel down - I would have been very disappointed if we had paid the full rate.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.disliked: — Minor inconveniences - elevators, no free wi-fi in room

reviews.text: I stayed for a 1 night stay over a Saturday night. The public areas and room both seemed fairly typical for Sheraton; nice enough, with no real problems. Service was fine though I didn't ask for much. As an SPG Platinum I got a nice upgrade to a corner suite.
reviews.title: Average Sheraton quality but abysmal self-parking

reviews.text: But if you have a car, the abysmal self-parking situation would eliminate this place for me in the future. There is a third-party parking lot about a 10 minute walk from the lobby, which at most times has only one booth open for exit. During the day, it can take 1/2 hour or more to get out of the lot because of long lines (it is a regular LAX airport parking lot, not just for the hotel) -- when you combine that with the long walk, it pretty much eliminates any advantage you have from being close to the airport. They do offer valet parking for more than double the cost of self parking; if I ever end up here again, there is no question I will spend the extra money and use the valet.
reviews.title: Nicely decorated but was kept up for 2 nights by noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with previous reviews that this hotel has some great positives.
reviews.title: Good if you need to stay next to LAX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the decor and the contemporary furniture. Front desk and bar staff were excellent, and conceirge helpful. We had a suite room that provided great space for 2 adults and 2 children. But the noise from neighbouring rooms was unbearable. And being an airport hotel people are checking in and out at all times.
reviews.title: Very thin walls.

reviews.text: On the first night we were woken at 4am by the neighbour checking out, to be followed by a maintenance team coming into the room and making noise. I let that slide and put it down to an unfortunate experience, but the second night a couple checked in at 2am and did not stop talking unitl 5am. I dont think they were particularly loud, but it sounded like they were sitting at the end of our bed. The noise just came straight through the connecting door that was right by our bed. To Sheraton's credit i complained at check out and they tried to make good the situation, but i'd rather had 2 nights sleep than a free breakfast! They asked why i didnt complain at night but i didnt feel that they were talking that loudly, Its just that the noise carries. I should also say that there was no noise from the actual airport. So perhaps this is were all the soundproofing went and they just put up cardboard between the rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a stop over

reviews.text: The Sheraton Park n' Fly is the reason I stay here (LAX Marriott has the same program), that and my SPG points. I like the hotel, it is convenient for the airport, the pool is nice and Shula's is good, but overpriced. The rooms are nice and the beds comfortable and they have good business services.
reviews.title: Convenient Airport Hotel
Red Light Hotel
reviews.text: All good so far.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives are the parking and the elevators. You HAVE to valet unless you want a half mile walk for self parking. The elevators have been messed up for a while now. They are so bad you have to use the staff elevators more often than not and it has been this way for a while.
reviews.title: OK for a transit stop

reviews.text: Will I stay here again? Yes.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has some good positives. It is a great hotel for someone looking for an overnight stay or maybe two days. If you have to been in L.A. more than two days there are a lot better places to stay and better locations.
reviews.title: Convenient Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels saving grace...the quick shuttle to the airport and the "heavenly beds"....wow, the best ever
reviews.title: Fun Memories

reviews.text: I arrived at LA Airport with no accommodation booked for a 20 hour layover and got on the Sheraton shuttle bus thinking this was a hotel brand I can usually trust. As usual the Sheraton lived up to its expected high standards.
reviews.title: Any closer to the airport and you'd be under a plane!

likes.liked: — Proximity to LA Airport - really the only reason to stay there.
likes.disliked: — Limited room service hours for real meals.

reviews.text: My mini suite was perfect. Clean, spacious, crisp linen etc. The leather couch was perfect for an afternoon nap in front of the TV.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds......ahhhhhhhhhhhh

reviews.text: I am actually surprised to read other reviews noting they found this pricey - I found it far cheaper than comparable accommodation and actually asked the receptionist if I had in fact heard the price right it seemed so cheap!
reviews.title: near airport but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle to the airport was literally minutes and I was assisted on and off both ends by the driver (always a worry getting luggage on and off when you are a female travelling solo).
reviews.title: Very nice airport hotel

reviews.text: The only minor disappointment I will note is that room service is not 24 hours. Being so close to an international airport I was more than a little annoyed I could not get a "proper" meal because it was 9am LA time even though I had just gotten off a 15 hour flight from Australia and desperately wanted something more substantial than a bagel!
reviews.title: Declining property

reviews.text: beware of the following charges when you stay as other reviewers have kindly mentioned:
reviews.title: Nice Room but

reviews.text: 1) hi-speed internet ($12 per 24 hrs? depending on membership level)
reviews.title: Paid for Parking!??
Sheraton Gateway LAX
reviews.text: 2) parking as mentioned previously - $24 valet, $12 self (but not attached to hotel building)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) if you stay on the Club floor, you still need to pay for beer/wine (breakfast/evening appetizers are served free)
reviews.title: Great for the price, make sure to get it cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4) bathrobe, wine opener must be requested (so that you will pay tip upon delivery)
reviews.title: Convenient for overnight lay-over at LAX

likes.disliked: — Not enough front desk help when lots of late night arrivals were waiting to check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent an evening at the Sheraton Gateway before a next day flight to New Zealand. Customer service by everyone from the front desk to the hotel restaurant was friendly and efficient. The continuous airport shuttle was frequent and reliable. Our room was spacious (though the bathroom was comparatively small) with modern furnishings, very comfortable bed, and an entertaining view of the LAX runways.
reviews.title: Relaxing Airport Stay

reviews.text: The overall feel of the public areas was like...an airport! The lobby and adjoining lounge were modern in design--clean, cool lines, but had little or no soundproofing. In the evening, the lounge pulsated with "techno" music and lots of twenty-somethings were drinking the night away. The noise level made it impossible to talk and relax. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening after flying in from Portland, OR and wanted to have a glass of wine before trying to sleep. We decided to take our wine back up to the room where relaxation was more likely.
reviews.title: Very Clean

reviews.text: The fitness center is excellent with up-to-date and well maintained equipment. The room looks out over the pool area, which is nicely landscaped. When sitting by the pool, you can almost forget you're steps away from LAX. Only the roar of jets taking off and landing keep you in the moment.
reviews.title: Room With a Runway View!

reviews.text: Overall, if staying at LAX is appropriate for your travel plans, the Sheraton Gateway makes a great choice!
reviews.title: Nice, reliable business hotel, close to LAX

likes.liked: — Close to airport, close to meeting place
likes.disliked: — Nothing walkable, no walkable restaurants other than restaurant in hotel

reviews.text: This Hotel was very nice but very snobby,my grandsons had gone down to the pool,they were 17 and 14 and was told by someone (prob. Someones body guard) that they couldn't touch the side of the pool and could not come near these 4 people (the only other ones in the pool) nor talk to them,don't know who they were but no one's that important.My daughter was right behind them and they wern't doing anything but this guy just kept on them.We arrived around 9:00pm and nothing was open,we hadn't had supper yet. I was sure glad we were only going to be there that night and only did so because it was at the airport.As far as looks and cleanness goes,I would give it a 5 star but as far as staff and help goes,it only deserves a 4 or maybe even a 3.The staff was also very snobby and not helpful at all.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel. Better than expected

likes.liked: — Clean room and location near where we needed to be

reviews.title: It was alright...
reviews.text: I had a friend from out of town that stayed at this hotel before flying out of LAX. I came down for the night to visit and stayed with her. The room was clean, and that was probably the best part of the stay. The bed was quite hard, and neither of us got much sleep. The sleep we got was also disturbed by planes taking off and landing, which, I admit; is something you have to deal with staying by the airport.

We also ate at Shula 347, which was the restaurant in the hotel. The prices were reasonable, and the food was quite good. The service could have been a little more attentive; but overall it was a fine experience.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
clean and family friendly
reviews.text: Overall, it was an okay experience; nothing to rave about, but nothing super exciting either.

reviews.title: One of the best bargains in LA
reviews.text: Excellent hotel near LAX. Got a room for $89 on priceline and it was a steal at that price. We had a late international flight and had to stay overnight in LA. Couldn't have picked a better hotel. Right next to the airport. We were helped with our baggage both ways. The shuttle to the airport is frequent. Rooms were nice and clean. Room service was good although expensive like most hotels. Even though its right next to the runway, there's no airplane sound. Nice views of the runway, enjoyed watching the planes land and takeoff.

Facilitated a Seminar at the Sheraton Gateway, we have been at this location a fews times in the past weeks. Excellent service by the hotel staff today! Begining with Sean from presentation services. Sean is invaluable to this Hotel. He is courteous, friendly, and efficient. The Food and beverage team included Estela Estreda, Jose Monroy, Robert Carrillo were all so efficient and courteous. The Banquet Captain, Moises Tamayo I have worked with for many years at a different Hotel and ever so pleased to see him here. He is always helpful with everything and anything he goes beyond to meet our group requirements even if he is not in charge of our meeting that day! Another invaluable employee.
reviews.title: Excellent service today!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway while visiting my girlfriend for the weekend. It was wonderful. The staff was prompt and courteous. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The bathroom was also in great shape with lots of water pressure for the shower. Overall, a very pleasant stay. I also had a very early departure, and the shuttle bus was a very quick trip back to the terminals at LAX.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton Gateway November 1 and 8 to bookend our international flight to China. Clean and modern hotel, good room, free shuttle just minutes from the airport. Very convenient for international flights. Attentive staff with good service. Hotel restaurant had a decent steak and salad which tasted wonderful after a week of Chinese!
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel
Good to catch an early flight out of LAX
reviews.text: Standard room, clean and modern. No view whatsoever but it's an Airport Hotel so it is to be expected. Roomy elegant bathroom. The Hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to LAX and that is the reason why we decided to stay there. Indeed the service was flawless even very early in the morning which made our transfer to LAX very easy. On the downside, we ordered room service. The hotel guarantees delivery within 40 mns according to their menu but when we called, they made it very clear that they do not guarantee the delivery and that it's a take it or leave it deal!! Now, fellow travelers, I will save you the hassle by telling you that the food was disgusting anyway.

Overall this hotel was fine. However we were shocked at the huge amount of mildew in the shower. Not a spot here and there but major mildew everywhere. We stayed on the pricier Club level, so can only imagine how the lower cost rooms are maintained. On a positive note, we had a surprisingly excellent dinner in their Italian restaurant with outstanding service!
reviews.title: If you like mildew you will love their showers!

aka: Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Hotel Los Angeles
description: Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Hotel is a sophisticated, high-tech accommodation with resort-style amenities. Near LAX, Santa Monica, and the Rose Bowl, our hotel has 50,000 sq ft of meeting space
